TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HtmlControlDesigner extends System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides basic design-time functionality for ASP.NET server controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the DHTML behavior that is associated with the designer.
Docs.value: An that is associated with the designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.Behavior%2A> property is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetAttribute%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.GetAttribute%2A> methods on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A> property to map properties to styles. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class to set styles for the control at design time.

Docs.summary: Gets the data bindings collection for the current control.
Docs.value: A that contains the data bindings for the current control.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Error: This property can no longer be referenced, and is included to support existing compiled applications. The design-time element may not always provide access to the element in the markup. There are alternate methods on WebFormsRootDesigner for handling client script and controls. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202", true)

Docs.summary: Gets the design-time object representing the control that is associated with the object on the design surface.
Docs.value: The design-time object representing the control associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.DesignTimeElement%2A> property is used by the designer to retrieve the design-time object representing the control that is associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner> object on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner> references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

block.para:
can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).

Docs.summary: Gets the expression bindings for the current control at design time.
Docs.value: An that contains the expressions strings set for properties in the current control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], uses the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilder> class to get the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionEditor> class to get the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionEditorSheet> to set expressions for control properties at design time. Expression strings reference a localizable resource, an application setting, a connection string, or a custom expression type.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.Expressions%2A> collection contains an <xref:System.Web.UI.ExpressionBinding> element for each control property that has an associated expression string. Each <xref:System.Web.UI.ExpressionBinding.ExpressionPrefix%2A> property for each element indicates the associated expression builder implementation. The expression string is parsed and evaluated by its associated <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilder> to determine the control property value at run time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the designer and sets the component for design.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method should be called by the designer host to initialize the designer.

block.para: During initialization, use the and methods on the property to map properties to styles.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnBehaviorAttached() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when a behavior is associated with the element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBehaviorAttached%2A> method is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetAttribute%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.GetAttribute%2A> methods on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A> property to map properties to styles. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class to set styles for the control at design time. Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method to manipulate the initial styles for the control at design time.

block.para: The method can be overridden and implemented to perform additional processing when a behavior is attached to the designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnBehaviorDetaching() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when a behavior disassociates from the element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBehaviorDetaching%2A> method is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetAttribute%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.GetAttribute%2A> methods on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A> property to map properties to styles. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class to set styles for the control at design time. Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.Dispose%2A> method for the control designer to perform actions before the designer object is released.

block.para: The M:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBehaviorDetaching method can be overridden and implemented to perform additional processing when a behavior is detached from the designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnBindingsCollectionChanged(string propName) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is to handle the Changed event on the DataBindings collection. The DataBindings collection allows more control of the databindings associated with the control. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.param: The name of the property that has changed.
Docs.summary: Provides a method that can be used to indicate when a data binding has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBindingsCollectionChanged%2A> method should be called by a control designer after the control designer has made a change to the data bindings for the control.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.OnBindingsCollectionChanged%2A> method is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBindingCollection.Changed> event on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.DataBindings%2A> collection for equivalent control designer functionality.

block.para: The method can be overridden and implemented to perform additional processing when the data bindings collection for the control has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnSetParent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides a way to perform additional processing when the associated control is attached to a parent control.

block.para: The method can be overridden and implemented to perform additional processing when the designer is attached to a parent control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterEvents(class System.Collections.IDictionary events) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains the names of the events of the component to expose.
Docs.summary: Sets the list of events that are exposed at design-time for the object for the component.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.PreFilterEvents%2A> method provides a way to add items to or remove items from the dictionary of events that a designer exposes through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object.
The keys in the dictionary of events are the names of the events. The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.

block.para: You can directly modify the dictionary that is accessible through or you can leave the dictionary unchanged. If you are overriding the method, call the base implementation before you perform your own filtering.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: The set of properties to filter for the component.
Docs.summary: Allows the designer to expose a specific set of properties through a object at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HtmlControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method provides a way to add items to or remove items from the dictionary of properties that a designer exposes through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are the names of the properties. The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.

block.para: You can directly modify the dictionary that is accessible through or you can leave the dictionary unchanged. If you are overriding the method, call the base implementation before you perform your own filtering.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ShouldCodeSerialize { get; set; }

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Use of this property is not recommended because code serialization is not supported. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create a field declaration for the control in the code-behind file for the current design document during serialization.
Docs.value: , if a declaration should be created; otherwise, .
